abstract.p: Christopher C Maggio reply to Oct 7 letter on curbinb massive alcohol consumption (S)

block.p: While educating Americans on how to drink may be a better answer to curbing massive alcohol consumption than striking down fraternities, another comparison of our drinking habits with those of the Europeans is worthwhile (''European Example,'' letter, Oct. 7).

While educating Americans on how to drink may be a better answer to curbing massive alcohol consumption than striking down fraternities, another comparison of our drinking habits with those of the Europeans is worthwhile (''European Example,'' letter, Oct. 7).

Many Europeans spend their college years at home and are not likely to find themselves in the midst of condoned lethal drinking. Age segregation among our college students limits their exposure to more experienced role models.
One attractive feature of the European pub life is the experience of the young and the old sharing their drinks for reasons other than getting drunk.
CHRISTOPHER C. MAGGIO Southborough, Mass., Oct. 7, 1997
